meanings.definition: A surface that has more than two dimensions.
meanings.sent1: The hypersurface of the cube was difficult to visualize due to its extra dimensions.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study hypersurfaces in mathematics to understand complex shapes.
meanings.sent3: The hypersurface of the alien spaceship seemed to bend reality itself.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a hypersurface of thoughts, intersecting and diverging in endless patterns.
meanings.sent5: The hypersurface of the ocean reflected the colors of the sunset, creating a mesmerizing sight.

meanings.definition: A surface that is defined by an equation in a higher-dimensional space.
meanings.sent1: The hypersurface of the equation represented a complex shape in four-dimensional space.
meanings.sent2: Mathematicians use hypersurfaces to model intricate geometric forms.
meanings.sent3: The hypersurface of the math problem twisted and turned, making it a challenge to solve.
meanings.sent4: In her dreams, the hypersurface of reality warped and shifted unpredictably.
meanings.sent5: The hypersurface of the galaxy was a tapestry of stars, swirling in cosmic dance.
